intro: Hymenophora denudata, commonly known as the naked leaf hymenophora, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often hairy on the underside. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the rainy season. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
